importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the current state of the postseason race as of this point in October 2025.
The scheduled start date of Game 1 of the World Series, marking the beginning of the final championship series between the Blue Jays and Dodgers.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which the postseason took place, including the ALCS and NLCS, culminating in the World Series preview.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the World Series for the first time in over 30 years after defeating the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in the AL Championship Series.
The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll in baseball, are the favorites to win the World Series, having won two titles and five pennants in the past nine seasons.
The Dodgers' success in the postseason, including a dominant NLCS sweep of the Brewers and a game-winning performance by Shohei Ohtani, shows their strength as a team.
The Blue Jays overcame a slow start in 2025 and a tough ALDS against the Yankees, showcasing a significant turnaround from their 2024 performance.
The Blue Jays' success in the ALCS was a hard-fought battle, marked by the Mariners' strong start and eventual collapse in Game 6 and Game 7.
The Blue Jays' offensive strength in putting balls into play has proven effective, but the Dodgers' superior defense and starting pitching present a major challenge.
The Dodgers' bullpen has been a weakness throughout the season, potentially offering a strategic vulnerability for the Blue Jays in the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Toronto, Canada.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are the team advancing to the World Series after a hard-fought ALCS win, marking their first appearance since 1993 and representing a significant milestone in their franchise history.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Los Angeles, California.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the defending World Series champions and the primary opponent in the upcoming World Series, representing the most dominant team in recent MLB history with a large payroll and strong postseason performance.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Seattle, Washington.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the opponents of the Blue Jays in the ALCS, representing a team that had never reached the World Series prior to this postseason and ultimately lost in Game 7, which set the stage for the Blue Jaysâ€™ World Series appearance.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way superstar player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, known for playing both as a pitcher and a hitter.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a historic performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, with three home runs as a batter and a 6.1-inning shutout as a pitcher, showcasing why the Dodgers are considered a dominant force in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays, who provided commentary after the team's ALCS victory.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman's post-game interview highlights the Blue Jays' resilience and determination, emphasizing how they stayed close throughout the series and ultimately won despite being outmatched in early games.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were defeated by the Dodgers in the NLDS, indicating the Dodgers' dominance in the postseason and their ability to beat a competitive team despite not being the highest-rated regular-season team.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were swept by the Dodgers in the NLCS, illustrating the Dodgers' dominance in the postseason and the strength of their team depth and pitching.

namedEntities.name: New York Yankees
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in New York, New York.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Yankees were the division rivals of the Blue Jays in the ALDS, where the Blue Jays outscored them with 34 runs over four games, showing their offensive strength and ability to overcome a tough opponent.

namedEntities.name: Pittsburgh Pirates
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB), based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Pirates defeated the Dodgers in a September sweep during the regular season, highlighting the Dodgers' inconsistency in the regular season and their struggles in late-game situations.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays have earned their first trip to the World Series in over 30 years by defeating the Seattle Mariners in a seven-game ALCS, marking a significant turnaround from their 2024 performance. The opposing team, the Los Angeles Dodgers, are the most dominant team in recent MLB history, with a record of two World Series titles and five pennants in the past nine seasons, and a strong postseason run, including a sweep of the Milwaukee Brewers and a historic performance by Shohei Ohtani. While the Blue Jays have shown strong offensive output, the Dodgers' superior pitching and defense make them a formidable opponent. The Blue Jays' potential to exploit the Dodgers' bullpen weakness could be key in the upcoming World Series, which begins on October 24 in Toronto.
title: Blue Jays Advance to World Series, Dodgers in the Way
